# API Analytics Demo

## Notebook information

7Zip Extract Library (https://github.com/miurahr/py7zr) is needed to run this notebook and extract the incoming data.
The library needs to be added to the Spark session (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/synapse-analytics/spark/apache-spark-manage-python-packages#session-scoped-packages-preview)

Content of yaml file below:
```yaml
name: unzip
channels:
  - defaults
dependencies:
  - pip:
    - py7zr==0.16.3
```

## Set some parameters

Can be overriden by Azure Synapse Pipelines

# Parameter Cell: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/synapse-analytics/spark/apache-spark-development-using-notebooks#integrate-a-notebook

# Storage account linked service name
linkedService = 'Main_DataLake_001'

# file system where 7z archive is located
container = 'abfss://apianalytics@dlsaesdwhtmp002data.dfs.core.windows.net'

# 7z file to extract
inputFile = '/temp/downloaded/ApiAnalyticsData.7z'

# target directory for extracted files
targetDir = '/temp/extracted'

import py7zr
from os import listdir
from notebookutils import mssparkutils

# set up mount point
mountPoint = '/fs-extract'
mssparkutils.fs.mount(container, mountPoint, { "linkedService": linkedService })

try: 
    # job session id required to access mount point files
    jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()

    # extraction
    mountPointPath = f"/synfs/{jobId}{mountPoint}"
    with py7zr.SevenZipFile(f"{mountPointPath}{inputFile}", mode='r') as z:
        z.extractall(path=f"{mountPointPath}/extract-{jobId}")

    # move from temporary to target path
    targetPath = f"{container}{targetDir}"
    mssparkutils.fs.rm(targetPath, True),
    mssparkutils.fs.mv(f"{container}/extract-{jobId}", targetPath, overwrite=True)

finally:
    # release mount point
    mssparkutils.fs.unmount(mountPoint)
